dict.string: CPUserDefaults provides a way of storing small amounts of data.
By default, the localStorage API will be used if the browser supports it. Otherwise a cookie fallback mechanism is utilized.
The first time that you run this code, it will save two values...
The first is an integer count; and the second is Spider-Man.
Open your AppController.j file and copy the code below inside applicationDidFinishLaunching: method...
